oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Department of Energy Photograph Collection
Red Cross volunteers sewing and knitting at Midtown Recreation Center
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Eight women in a room are sewing and knitting.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American Red Cross; Interiors; Knitting; Midtown Recreation Center; Sewing machines
Dykman, Mrs. Orrie J.; Lawrence, Mrs. J. Vincent; Melin, Mrs. Carl L.; Royer, Mrs. Luther H.; Tubb, Mrs. Preston E.; Whitehouse, Mrs. Joseph
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Six women on right (from L to R) are identified in Oak Ridge Journal of March 15, 1945 as Mrs. Preston E. Tubb; Mrs. Luther H. Royer; Mrs. J. Vincent Lawrence; Mrs. Orrie J. Dykman; Mrs. Joseph Whitehouse and Mrs. Carl L. Melin. The two women on the far left are not identified.
PRO 346-1; 3-8-1945; Red Cross Sewing and Knitting, Midtown Recreation Center
